alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 8:43AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Anderson County through 915 AM CDT... At 843 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Garnett, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Garnett, Colony, Kincaid and Lone Elm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
